name: The Blue Lion Inn, Pub and Restaurant with Accommodation
text: Having known this lovely inn for over 30 years, I was slightly worried that it might have changed under its new management.  I need not have worried! We stayed for the weekend and everything was absolutely first-class. The staff are friendly and welcoming, the room was comfortable, warm and spotless. And the food. What to say about the food?  It's fantastic.  The lovely old bar with the roaring fire - perfect.  We couldn't have had a nicer weekend. Wonderful.

name: The Blue Lion Inn, Pub and Restaurant with Accommodation
text: Just returned from a fabulous night away  at the Blue Lion. First visit since the new owners took over. We were thrilled to find the character had not changed but were given a warm, friendly greeting, clean rooms and then served super food and drinks by friendly staff who were clearly happy in their roles (Recommend the cheese souffle followed.by.the.venison in a suet crust) This was followed in the morning by a hearty breakfast. We cannot wait to return soon

name: The Blue Lion Inn, Pub and Restaurant with Accommodation
text: I stayed here on Saturday night for 1 night and ate in the restaurant with my family. There was 10 of us total who all stayed the night. We had an excellent evening. The pub is very warm and cosy with a lit fire and traditional d√©cor throughout. The staff were lovely and the food was very good. The menu also was very good as there was 3-4 items I could have easily tried on each course. & everything was cooked perfectly that I ate. The rooms were also very spacious and had good amenities. I would have liked to see a TV in there as well as a hairdryer but tbh I did not need one desperately. We had a very good nights sleep too. The only slight thing to critique was the wifi strength was not brilliant (there was no 4G) but it did work. It is often nice to disconnect for a few hours so this is a very minor thing. Lastly the breakfast included in the room rate was top notch. Great selection and again cooked breakfast was served to perfection. I would stay again in a heartbeat. Thank you for a great stay.

name: The Blue Lion Inn, Pub and Restaurant with Accommodation
text: Under new owners the Blue Lion had not just returned to its former high standards but exceeded them.  The rooms have all been refreshed and the staff are very welcoming.  The food was fabulous - we had sea bass, lamb,  venison and desserts, all superb and with great service.  Thanks for a great stay - we‚Äôll be back again very soon!

name: The Blue Lion Inn, Pub and Restaurant with Accommodation
text: A beautiful staycation with a warm Yorkshire welcome. The icing on the cake for me was the food was such another level. The green apple üçè souffl√© needs to be experienced -Totally yummy and adapted due to me being gluten free. Also the pheasant was soo fresh and cooked in a very French way. The rooms were lovely and warm with very comfy beds and are about to part of a refurbishment project in the summer. The rooms were ready  a bit of a tweak.  Lovely lovely foodie stay ü•Çüôè

name: The Half Moon Inn
text: Visiting the area and stopped off for dinner. Very warm welcome front the staff, cosy atmosphere and the food was great quality. Excellent portions. Would highly recommend

name: The Half Moon Inn
text: We forgot that it was Mothering Sunday (Mother‚Äôs Day) and we couldn‚Äôt get in anywhere for lunch. By chance we stopped here and they had a table for two. We had the carvery lunch which included generous portions of roast beef, pork, and turkey with Yorkshire pudding, roast and mashed potatoes, veg, and all the trimmings. The whole thing was made even better with the first pint of Theakston that I‚Äôd had in years.  The food was excellent and the landlord and staff very welcoming. What a find!

name: The Half Moon Inn
text: The Half Moon family run pub comes highly recommended for the cheerful & friendly atmosphere & excellent food, Carvery Sunday March 12th we needed assistance as our friend passed out (twice) nothing was to much trouble, it was genuinely so kind and they looked after us.John&Chris & most importantly Linda who is now fully recovered would like to say a very big thank you to Colin & Tracy & members of staff & we will .see you again soon,,

name: The Half Moon Inn
text: Lovely carvery in a really nice place. Service excellent and very good price

name: The Half Moon Inn
text: Staying locally we thought we would try the Half Moon Inn as recommended.. My pie was exceptional , meaty and full of flavour, gravy one of the nicest I've had in a pie , chips were flavoursome and veg cooked well. Service was great , friendly,  speedy and professional , faultless.. The reason it's a 4 not a 5 is because I don't think a dog should be allowed in the eating area especially one that begs for food and if ignored sits there tapping your leg. Is a lovely old dog and I love dogs , have my own but do have areas dogs shouldn't be. Thank you....

name: Restaurant at The Sportsman's Arms
text: If you like snazzy this place is for you, or at least one of their rooms is for you. The outside and the entrance seating didn‚Äôt give the posh vibe at all. We reserved a table but we weren‚Äôt given the choice where to sit which is fine but to me it makes a big difference. I didn‚Äôt know enough about the place, I though it was just a typical pub that served food. The waiters even took it very seriously, I felt like I was in Paris or something. Anyway I can‚Äôt really fault them on that that‚Äôs just my preference, this place would definitely float many peoples boats. The food portion size were okay‚Ä¶ but the prices are definitely up there. I had a three course and by the end I was full and happy, which I guess you should expect. I think this place would suit many people especially if you‚Äôre thinking of a special meal with a special person üôÇ

name: Restaurant at The Sportsman's Arms
text: Fantastic food and a stunning location. Building is also very pretty and well maintained. Service started a bit iffy, I wanted to sit outside and there was only one other table occupied, I was very abruptly told I needed a table number, like I had just committed the greatest sin of the 21st century. After resolving my crime of the century my food was delivered to the table, a nice beef sandwich and chips.....no asking if I would like any sauces for my chips or anything like that, you get what you're given. Can't tell if this is because I wasn't a local or if it's because I'm a biker and it's an upmarket establishment.....which is funny because my Harley was worth more than 90% of the cars in the car park.....but I digress. When I went back in for a second drink, service picked up, I was asked if I enjoyed my meal and staff were friendlier this time. I try not to hold grudges hence the 4 star rating but while I'm not local, this was my 4th visit in two weeks and only this time did I have issues, maybe they don't like bikers here or I just caught them on a bad day?

name: Restaurant at The Sportsman's Arms
text: Excellent pub / restaurant Are there on consecutive days. Good selection of beer and other drinks at the bar. Food was excellent- my favourite was the venison. The photo is the lamb A bit more expensive than your normal pub Excellent staff - very friendly and helpful

name: Restaurant at The Sportsman's Arms
text: B and B and everything meal treat from our Son and partner for our 31st wedding anniversary x.  Everything has been beautiful, what a fabulous place that we would love to visit again.  Thank you for making everything special.  Buddy loved it too xx

name: Restaurant at The Sportsman's Arms
text: This is a great place to eat, friendly staff, good food, and even an open fire. Food was well presented, perfectly cooked and in sensible quantities. Lots of local options as well; beers, fish and game. Highly recommended if you are nearby, though the road to get there is a bit tight in places.

name: The Foresters Arms
text: Really lovely pub. We had a warm welcome and immediately felt at home.  Rarely have we found a pub with such a relaxed atmosphere.  The food was delicious, our dogs liked it tooüòä

name: The Foresters Arms
text: A nice village pub with good food in generous portions, beer is varied and well kept, the black sheep ale is recommended. Hosts are friendly and welcoming and the crowd seemed quite friendly. Lovely location and a lovely little pub to match.

name: The Foresters Arms
text: Terrific food at very reasonable prices with an extensive menu. Best fish & chips I‚Äôve had for ages. Fabulous banter from the staff. Don‚Äôt ask questions about the menu or you‚Äôll need trauma therapy üòâ

name: The Foresters Arms
text: Only popped in for one...ended up having two!  Really friendly staff, the lady behind the bar on Friday afternoon was really friendly.  I think it's got new owners, best of luck to them.

name: The Foresters Arms
text: Called in for Sunday lunch. Great traditional roast with all the trimmings, and good price. Well kept Theakstons bitter, choice of Black Sheep and another draught bitter too. Friendly service.

name: Johnny Baghdad's Cafe on the Square
text: No idea what the name has to do with a small North Yorkshire cafe, with internal  decoration from Vietnam and other far east countries. However, this IS A CAFE TO VISIT. Great food & wonderful staff. Plus really friendly customers, in the winter anyway. I had the smoked salmon & dill quiche - delicious. I spoke to the couple on the next table, they were local.& used the cafe all the time. The food looked amazing. Deep joy on the faces of everyone. I can recommend the chocolate & pistachio cake. (Had previously as a gift from the wife)

name: Johnny Baghdad's Cafe on the Square
text: Cracking. A brilliant cafe. Great quality, well cooked food. Cyclists welcome. Full English hit the spot. Good coffee also. Gets very busy at peak times and queues outside the front not uncommon, but well worth it once you're sat down üëå

name: Johnny Baghdad's Cafe on the Square
text: Had a lovely late lunch at Johnny Baghdad's. Waitress was super nice and accomodating. We say outside but the inside looked cozy too.  The menu was innovative, interesting and covered many bases (cakes were great too!).  But the most important bit --- food very tasty.

name: Johnny Baghdad's Cafe on the Square
text: Johnny Baghdad's Cafe was fabulous. Great vibe and fantastic food choices. Only had coffee and cake today but looking forward to going back for a meal sometime soon. The coffee was very nice, Americano and warm milk.. (I'm not normally a big fan but this was superb. Accompanied by chocolate and Guinness cake. My friend had sticky chocolate orange cake which was equally excellent. Lovely friendly staff. Cant recommend highly enough. 6 stars üåü

name: Johnny Baghdad's Cafe on the Square
text: When in the UK, we were lucky to stumble across this dope little cute caf√©! A great little quaint joint to grab some grub, hot chocolates or coffee after a walk in the country. Support local businesses!

name: The Black Bull Middleham
text: I have just come back from a lovely mid week two night stay at the Black Bull in Middleham. I stayed in room 1 which was very spacious with a large double bed and superb shower. The owners Sam and Harriet plus the rest of the team are all great hosts and you really feel like you are part of the local community staying at the pub. Breakfast is also superb and set me up well for my cycling adventures. MIddleham and the surrounding area really is a beautiful part of the country with plenty to explore right on your doorstep. I will certainly be back again soon.

name: The Black Bull Middleham
text: Great traditional pub, friendly staff. We had a lovely couple of pints and some fantastic home cooked food. Both of us opted for the Steak and Ale pie which came with triple cooked chips, mushy peas and red wine gravy. Absolutely delicious

name: The Black Bull Middleham
text: An absolutely lovely place to stay, the room was well decorated and set out, spacious, the bed was very comfortable, nice thick duvet even though the room was nice and warm. The bar has a good selection of lager, cider and Ales, there is also a good selection of spirits, especially the Forged Gin !! We also ate here and the food was fantastic! Good selection of juices and cereals and also the choice of a cooked breakfast, we opted for the full English of course which was amazing. Zero complaints about anything during our stay, the bar staff are all lovely too, and the landlord Sam was always on hand to help if needed. We can‚Äôt wait to stay here again in December , Middleham is a lovely little village.

name: The Black Bull Middleham
text: Great little pub with great food. Breakfast was plentiful and set us up for the day. Bed was super comfortable and huge! Staff are very friendly and nothing was to much trouble. We only stayed the one night as we were visiting the forbidden corner a couple of miles away. Only negative points (sorry as I forgot to mention it in the morning), we couldn't get the tv to work, no biggy as it was just 1 night and the bathroom wall needs some tlc but the rooms were spotless. Would definatly recommend anyone to stay and a point i have forgotten to mention is the WiFi is very good if you need to catch up on emails. Thanks to the black bull!

name: The Black Bull Middleham
text: Very nice place to have an evening drink outside. We were there mid July 2021 and its the last place in the square to receive the evening sunshine.  A variety of meals and selection of ales. Very reasonable prices too.  We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. Sadly only limited seating outdoors.

name: The North End Cafe
text: Four of us dropped in here on our way home from holiday for a breakfast to see us through the journey. We were instantly met and welcomed by the owner(?) /manager(?) and given a table in the window. He very kindly gave us a parking permit to use while we were there, which he later gave us for keeps. A waitress soon took our order of 4 Yorkshire breakfasts and teas and coffees etc. While we waited the cafe quickly filled up, so glad to have got there when we did. Breakfast arrived in about 10 minutes and was very good. All local produce and the eggs were amazing. All in all a great choice for us. I heartily recommend anyone to the North End Cafe. And a big thank you to all the staff!

name: The North End Cafe
text: Visited today as a small family of four, we were met with a warm welcome and Cafe was filled with happy customers and an eclectic mix of furniture which we loved. The food was simple on paper but clearly made with fresh and top quality ingredients, also really nicely presented. All facilities were super clean! If you're in the area, we couldn't recommend The North End Cafe enough...A little Gem.

name: The North End Cafe
text: Breakfast was plentiful using only quality, locally sourced produce. Coffee was good too. Good mix of seating and attentive staff

name: The North End Cafe
text: Beautiful food and excellent service! Great options for people with dietary restrictions

name: The North End Cafe
text: Detoured off the A1M to  try get a decent breakfast.  Very glad we did.  The Yorkshire Terrier breakfast was top class. The home baking also looked delicious. This is a lovely cafe. Friendly staff and delicious food.  If nearby, you must give it a try.

name: Studley Tearoom
text: The Tearoom,it goes without saying was exceptionally busy, that's not too hard to work out when you consider hundred of visitors are wandering round this magnificent  attraction having probably walked the equivalent of a "half marathon"on a sunny day, needless to say it was very good and much appreciated.üëçüëç

name: Studley Tearoom
text: A cute quaint and authentic joint to grab some coffee whilst on a dog walk in the UKs backcountry! Support local businesses!

name: Studley Tearoom
text: Always a long que and typically a wait for hot drinks but otherwise a nice rest stop, particularly to sit by he lake. Dogs friendly outside seating area but not inside.

name: Studley Tearoom
text: Great location. But very standard national trust food selection. So worth a visit bit don't be expected to be wowed by the food choices.

name: Studley Tearoom
text: A nice spot to enjoy a brew -or a veggie curry pastie in my case today. ü§§ 'Tis a shame due to ongoing Pandemic precautions the usual seating's outdoor only, but it's still a very scenic spot overlooking the adjacent lake. Sorry no snap of the veg curry pastie, but here's one of the cute Jackdaw that I gave a few crust crumbs.

name: Taste of India
text: Reasonable meal with work colleagues...table a bit dark, needed torch on phone to read menu Waiter wouldn't give a receipt saying the card machine receipt was enough and if i wanted to take a picture on my phone I could!!!! card machine receipt didnt event have full address on  In my 40 years of travelling I have never been refused a receipt, ever......VERY POOR

name: Taste of India
text: This place came highly recommended by the locals and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. We arrived late on a Saturday night and they were able to find a table for us. Everything was great - The poppadoms were fresh and crunchy - the curries were flavoursome. Most importantly the beer was served ice cold! Staff were attentive, friendly and fast! Also, we really liked the unusual decor! The ceiling features a sort of upside down garden - it‚Äôs really quite extraordinary and bold. Great original touch!!

name: Taste of India
text: Amazing indian food! The butter chicken was great! The naan bread was delicious. Overall a great experience, great for sharing with outstanding service and kind staff!  Would recommend!

name: Taste of India
text: Lovely Family Run restaurant. They cater not only for the beginner pallet that want to build up their spice tolerance they also cater for the season curry veteran. For the more adventurous they even offer a real Bangladeshi option of curries that are full of flavour and spice which are all served with a smile. I look forward to my next experience here.

name: Taste of India
text: The food was absolutely delicious,  it was only let down a little by the hour long wait we had for the takeaway.  Judging by others we will probably order by phone next time and then go in, as all other takeaway orders seem to have done. Having said that, when we ate the food it was really good and we will definitely be back.

name: The Barn
text: Poor value. I appreciate the cost of living has gone up and effects every industry and sector in many ways but quality and value still should be a factor that remains in service and that isn't compromised. I ordered a ¬£12.95 steak burger that was a slither of lettuce and eye drop of relish away from the same burger from the kids menu in a dry low quality bread bun. Pictures paint a thousand words. This is a ¬£5 burger at most. Slightly underwhelming for the price

name: The Barn
text: Had another lovely meal here tonight. Mentioned last night after finishing our meal that steak would be lovely as a choice on the menu for Valentines night. Arrived at the Barn for our meal to see steak as a special on the menu. Great service from Lyndsey and Richard and all the staff. Always a friendly and warm welcome from everyone. Thankyou for another lovely meal.

name: The Barn
text: Great , home cooked food . Brilliant service and lovely atmosphere and surroundings

name: The Barn
text: Not a huge menu choice but what we had was good, a little pricey nonetheless, but as a campsite pub exclusivity comes at a premium, not that busy but still had to attract staff attention to order food, and again to pay,

name: The Barn
text: Lovely food, nice pint of cider and very dog friendly! Rang on a whim for a table and accommodated no problem (Monday night) really nice place, if we were staying longer in the area we'd definitely return.

name: Richard ‚Ö¢ Hotel
text: Great pub for atmosphere but sadly a disappointing choice of ales. Only 3 of potentially 5 offered and those 3 were no different to anything else offered nearby.

name: Richard ‚Ö¢ Hotel
text: Lovely old pub/hotel, cosy rooms, good food, good beers. Very friendly staff. Roaring fires in the bars. Good atmosphere.

name: Richard ‚Ö¢ Hotel
text: Good food, fast service even though busy. Lovely surroundings and a cosy atmosphere with good fires. Strongly recommended!

name: Richard ‚Ö¢ Hotel
text: Amazing little hotel, rooms over the pub, which even when very busy, was not too loud upstairs.  Cracking staff and food was amazing.

name: Richard ‚Ö¢ Hotel
text: Food was very nice and price very reasonable. Also beer was good value for the area.

name: The Fox & Hounds Inn
text: Fabulous local pub! Delicious food. Cozy atmosphere. Beautifully acquainted guest rooms with the most comfortable bed I‚Äôve ever slept on! Joanne and John are the best hosts. Can‚Äôt recommend this place more!

name: The Fox & Hounds Inn
text: Staying a few nights in North Yorkshire, visited here for evening meal! Definitely recommend Steak and Chips. The steak tasted lovely and was perfectly cooked to medium. Also highly recommend the apple and Berry crumble 100%! Hats off to the chef! On top of great food, the staff were lovely too, attentive and very polite and friendly!

name: The Fox & Hounds Inn
text: We visited here after we had walked all day. Great for walkers, warm fire burning, staff were friendly and welcoming. Service was prompt our  multiple drink orders. Facilities all very clean and modern. Much appreciated.

name: The Fox & Hounds Inn
text: Charming pub, great service and lovely friendly locals who made us feel at home. I can't comment on the rooms or food as we just had a drink

name: The Fox & Hounds Inn
text: Nipped in for lunch on the way home and it was really nice. Open fire, good beer and the Tandoori Chicken burger I had was great.

name: Freemasons Arms
text: Would 100% recommend The Freemasons Arms for food which is very good. I had the steak pie which was one of the best I have ever had. I followed this with the crumble which was again very very good. However can I mention Hannah who greated us with the warmest of welcomes and was very friendly during our visit. It goes a long way when you get 1st class service along with superb food. Will definitely return.

name: Freemasons Arms
text: A complete gem of a gastropub only minutes away from junction 50 on the A1. Car parking available opposite the pub is a little limited but the premises are modern and tastes fully appointed. The service is personable, friendly and helps makes a fantastic ambience. The menu is interesting and varied, with good quality produce and beautiful presentation. Two wood burners just add to the effect. Excellent food - would strongly recommend.

name: Freemasons Arms
text: Really nice platters and the service was really good, really nice to see such a great place open again and we will be back for some more of that good food

name: Freemasons Arms
text: Went for a family meal and the food was amazing. I would highly reccomend going for a meal. Friendly staff too.

name: Freemasons Arms
text: One of the BEST meals we‚Äôve had anywhere in a long long time! Absolutely superb and can‚Äôt wait to go back again on our next visit up to Yorkshire in August for hubby‚Äôs birthday! Lovely to see so many villagers as well as outsiders use this pub. Refurbishment done very well, staff super friendly and doggy friendly in the bar area! Do book as it gets super busy even on week nights! Highly recommend

name: Spice of Bengal
text: Under new management and it was a fatastic night will  definitely be going again food was lovely

name: Spice of Bengal
text: Ordered online from their website. Order was accepted. Was due to be collected at 6.35pm. Set off in my car at about 6.10pm. Upon arrival, there was a message from the restaurant at 6.18pm that they were closed and order cancelled. To my surprise, the restaurant was open. I enquired as to why my order had been cancelled and was told that they were not accepting online orders and my money would be refunded. No apology was offered and the person was very offhand. DON'T ORDER ONLINE!

name: Spice of Bengal
text: 2 of us wandered in on a Sunday evening for a sit-down meal. Hadn't booked... Of the 3 curry houses in Bedale, this looks the most unassuming. Don't be deceived or put off by that - we found the food to be excellent. Starter: sharing platter for 2. Arrived sizzling & tasted great. Freshly cooked & plenty of it. Mains were of similarly high quality, tasting great & also seemed to be freshly cooked. Of the 3 curries we had on our recent holiday, this restaurant served the best meat to sauce ratio. üòä Another bonus was the price: having paid ¬£50+ for similar menu choices earlier in my holiday, & though that to be "ok" value-wise, our bill here came to sub-¬£40, & tasted even better. Result! Just need to find an excuse to go back there...

name: Spice of Bengal
text: Had a takeaway, really tasty and filling

name: Spice of Bengal
text: 11 of us (six adults, five children) visited Saturday 12/09/20 - we hadn't booked - the food was excellent, hot and tasty and met our various needs (gluten free, vegan, pescatarian). VERY reasonable price too. Would definitely recommend.

name: Co-op Food - Masham
text: Plenty of parking and great service. Very well stocked. Clean and tidy Great customer service Definitely 5 stars for the overall shopping experience

name: Co-op Food - Masham
text: Very well stocked... But no bottle bank or package recycling

name: Co-op Food - Masham
text: Just a relatively small, local convenience store stocking most of the general day to day requirements and normal Co-op brands.

name: Co-op Food - Masham
text: Good value products, this Co-op had everything we needed for a quick shop whilst on holiday. Managed to get some good bargains in here and the staff were really nice. The shop itself was really well kept from the outside and inside, even though I do not usually comment on the cleanliness of a shop, this was noticeably clean and tidy.

name: Co-op Food - Masham
text: Best local shop in the county. Friendly staff, will take suggestions for products & stock them. Very good range of stock, fresh veg, great meat. All at a good price. Easy atmosphere, so functional unlike other crowded, crabby shops. Great to browse or dash!!

name: Jakes Plaice
text: Horrifically bad fish and chips. No customers there, I wouldn't have gone there unless my elderly parents had insisted. Everything wrong that can be wrong with fish and chips. Greasy, bad tasting fish, chips overcooked in oil too cold. Oil dripping off the paper. Overpriced and shameless. Avoid at all costs so someone else can take it over and do it properly.

name: Jakes Plaice
text: This was the worst fish and chips I have ever had in my life. The oil was dripping off the fish and it tasted sour, I was then told there was only one size portions and she proceeded to put about 20 chips in a bag and ask for ¬£8 I shouldn‚Äôt have paid. Time for a change of profession

name: Jakes Plaice
text: Worst fish ever. It was so dried up my husband took it back for me. Meanwhile his fish and chips were getting cold and his fish was equally disgusting. Waste of ¬£14 for 2 fish and a bag of chips.

name: Jakes Plaice
text: Appalling Food standards, the fish was Tuff, bland and greasy. The batter was chewy and discoloured. The chips were almost ok but I wouldn't even dare feed that "food" to my cat. Overall the food was inedible. (definitely reheats). I strongly advise that you stay away from this so-called restaurant This was an absolute waste of money  If it stays like this it will be shut down by the food standards agency!

name: Jakes Plaice
text: You‚Äôd expect chips to be at least decent from a fish and chips shop however these were just awful. Tasted like the beef dripping (if your vegetarian it‚Äôs also a no no!) was overused and for ¬£1.80 for a small chips which quite frankly wasn‚Äôt even a child‚Äôs portion I wouldn‚Äôt bother again. One to avoid!

name: The Terrace Restaurant
text: We‚Äôve been for afternoon tea and lunch here several times now and it never disappoints. The Terrace has a beautiful modern setting (indoors and out) which is a real counterpoint to the very trad setting of the hotel.  They cater for vegetarians and various dietary intolerances. One of our party this week is gluten intolerant and everything on the menu was available to her. She said the bread in her sandwich was fantastic.  The burger never disappoints!  Like the new small plates options too.

name: The Terrace Restaurant
text: I had southern coated chicken to start which I can highly recommend, followed by an outstanding burger. Service was great everyone very friendly.

name: The Terrace Restaurant
text: The food is not very good here, nor are the wait staff. Our fish cakes were unbelievably salty, so much so we barely made it half way through them and downed all of the table water. When we raised it with the waiter they were ambivalent to our feedback; a few moments later and we saw the chef shaking his head and bickering about our comments. Nice setting but I‚Äôd stick to hot drinks / snacks and avoid a main course here.

name: The Terrace Restaurant
text: Amazing food . Staff were very friendly and helpful. Beautiful  surroundings.

name: The Terrace Restaurant
text: Just had a coffee and a sandwich, but we will be coming back.

name: Co-op Food - Bedale
text: ¬£3.35 for the cheapest gf loaf of bread. Ridiculous, bumped your prices by 50p in the past few months. Hate when I'm forced to shop his prices are getting silly. Can't wait till they close and hopefully asda replaces this shop.

name: Co-op Food - Bedale
text: They took away my favourite snack the m&m bars üíÄ

name: Co-op Food - Bedale
text: Right in the middle of Bedale, you can park easily in the spaces off the main road (one of those discs required in certain times). Quite deceptively large store which is well stocked for both quick and weekly shop.

name: Co-op Food - Bedale
text: Very smart now it's been done up. But I don't think stock has increased, and I can now never find the back door!!ü§£

name: Co-op Food - Bedale
text: Now they've finished their upgrade it's such an improvement. Bigger, and more produce to chose from, it's even easier now to spend my money there on my lunch break looking for a tea for later!

name: Kirkby Fisheries
text: The best fish and chips we have ever had..... and we've had a lot!!! Service is amazing, always happy and chatty. Highly recommend üëå

name: Kirkby Fisheries
text: We popped in after a trip to Studley Royal Deer Park. The fish and chips were delicious and served with a smile. Will visit again when we are up that neck of the woods!

name: Kirkby Fisheries
text: Best Fish and Chips in the North of England. ***** 5 Star all day Long.*****  Me and my wife came across this chippy by luck. What can I say... The fish was perfectly cooked, nice and crispy, and tasted amazing with the perfect batter! Highly recommend! Thanks for making my day. The only problem for me is that its 100 miles from my house. But its still worth the trip.  See you next Saturday. Stan

name: Kirkby Fisheries
text: Excellent fish üê† and chips üçü. Definitely recommend if you are in the area but check the opening times first.

name: Kirkby Fisheries
text: Great little fish and chip shop in the village. I had the fish and chips one night . The fish was tasty and there was a good portion of chips. Two days later I went and tried the pizzas and they were excellent. The dough base was light and crispy and there was a good amount of tasty toppings . I would highly recommend if you are in the area.

name: The Food Weighouse - Bedale
text: Asked Mark to send me some whole cloves as we couldn't find any in our area at the right price to finish a project off.  He couldn't do enough for us, nothing was too much trouble. He was extremely helpful and suggested we buy in bulk as we needed quite a few packs. Mark was a pleasure to do business with. I'll definitely use them in future, even though we live miles away.

name: The Food Weighouse - Bedale
text: Helpful and friendly! The staff are patient and understanding, and will help everyone looking for ingredients and good quality food.

name: The Food Weighouse - Bedale
text: Great shop. Christmas cake mix. Always excellent.

name: The Food Weighouse - Bedale
text: Lots of variety, pick 'n' mix, and friendly staff. :)

name: The Food Weighouse - Bedale
text: Nice and cheap

name: The Milbank Arms
text: Went for Sunday lunch actually chose from special boards. 1 had lamb shank the other had vegetarian option. Both were really good. Well cooked very hot, plain food suited us perfectly. Staff were excellent too. Will definitely go back.

name: The Milbank Arms
text: Had a truly delicious Sunday lunch this weekend. Food heavenly, vegetables cooked to perfection and perfect Yorkshire pudding. Staff friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend Excellent value,many thanks  üëå

name: The Milbank Arms
text: Lovely meal last night. Highly recommend the duck balls and arrancini starters. The veg with the steak pie came with a bit of crunch - perfect. Will be back to try more. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

name: The Milbank Arms
text: Stopped for a light lunch. The landlord very friendly & welcoming. Food excellent Must return next time travelling up North

name: The Milbank Arms
text: Lovely staff but food is average. Has a good function room for larger parties but all in all me and my husband didn't love the food. Mum and dad liked it so that's all that matters.

name: The Sprouted Kitchen
text: An absolute gem!  We have had large platters in our office for the last two years running. They provide a wide range of vegan options that are gorgeous, and it does not feel like a hassle when we request them!  Really friendly service & at a good price too. It's my go-to lunch spot in Bedale now.

name: The Sprouted Kitchen
text: What a find! This is a foodies paradise with excellent choices for veggies as well as meat dishes. Service was warm, friendly, and helpful, dealing with our allergies sensibly and knowledgably. Our meals were served promptly. The food was delicious and the drinks were good quality and piping hot! We will definitely return!

name: The Sprouted Kitchen
text: Best food in Bedale excellent staff and wonderful service. The quality and presentation of the meals is beautiful. They are only open from Thursday to Saturday. They are located on the bridge over the river and have both inside and outside seating. It's not possible to park here but a large car park is located on other side of the main road. It is a 8 minute walk from town centre.

name: The Sprouted Kitchen
text: Found this cute little place while traveling and it‚Äôs definitely worth the visit. Super delicious food and little bits and bobs throughout the shop to browse and purchase. Would definitely love to sit outside to watch the river when it‚Äôs warmer!

name: The Sprouted Kitchen
text: This is an absolute gem of a place. It's a  cross between a great local caf√© and a high quality brunch restaurant, all set in a slightly ramshackle but well presented cabin alongside the river. The staff are friendly, covid attentive, and really helpful. Front of house Lucy, and Chef Luke combine to make an informal meal into a real experience. Imaginative but accessible cooking which  adds plenty of interesting flavours and textures to typical brunch dishes and daily specials. Great value, great service and brilliant food.

name: Pinch of This
text: 3 of us had a wonderful lunch here, Two had the cooked breakfast and said it was all super quality. In particular they both praised the sausages, which is incredible as one is very fussy about them!  I myself had a toasted sandwich and it was great, again quality ingredients and a lovely fresh salad with dressing.  Credit also to the staff/owners, everyone was really welcoming and friendly - they also went the extra mile to make sure my allergies were accommodated which was much appreciated.  Definitely would recommend and will return the next time we are in Bedale.

name: Pinch of This
text: Popped in here on Saturday afternoon and had a delicious snack of Rarebit on sourdough. Even though the kitchen was just on the point of closing they were very happy to squeeze us in and we are so pleased they did. Lovely food and very pleasant and friendly staff and manager. Dog friendly too (always a bonus)!  Definitely recommend and will call back in next time we‚Äôre in the area

name: Pinch of This
text: What a lovely cafe. First impressions were great, super clean cafe (no sticky tables here), friendly staff.  The menu was slightly different to the usual offerings which made a welcome change. I had goats cheese and onion quiche (lovely) with a fresh side salad, husband had a chorizo hash which he thoroughly enjoyed.  We also got a few cakes to take out, we haven't had them yet but they look very enticing.  To cap it all the prices seem extremely reasonable and the toilets were roomy and super clean also.  A gem of a cafe, well worth a visit.

name: Pinch of This
text: Friendly, attentive staff. Gorgeous meat and vegan full breakfasts. Excellent coffee in a little gem of a cafe, who also bake their own scones and cakes. Bedale is also a lovely place to stop off en route on the A1M and it's only 1.5 miles from junction 51. A great find.

name: Pinch of This
text: Arrived for brunch on a Sunday morning, friendly welcome to us all including our three dogs.  Full breakfast was delicious, lattes hot and everything was cooked while we waited. The whole cafe had a warm friendly vibe, there were obviously regulars there who were greeted like friends. We were lucky enough to be able to buy freshly made scones before we left. My husband & I returned a little later to have our flasks filled with hot chocolate for our journey home, the drinks were still hot 3 hours later! We will certainly return if we are in Bedale again, cannot fault the service from all and we thoroughly recommend them. Thanks to you all.

name: Spice Restaurant & Bar Bedale
text: The food was lovely and plentiful. Everyone was very happy with their choices, and we shared some dishes like the Dall and naans. We noted that the takeaway side of the business was brisk and felt this may have impacted on the dining side as service was slow at times, especially the drinks. Also of note on the booths area the seating was all very tired  and in some areas in need of urgent repair. Next time, we'll ask to sit on the chairs and tables for a party of 5 rather than the booths.

name: Spice Restaurant & Bar Bedale
text: Absolutely terrible would never order again worst curry all 7 of us have ever tasted! Taste less bland had a lamb dish and never had any tomato or peppers in as described just full of onion

name: Spice Restaurant & Bar Bedale
text: Food was excellent. The young waiter was very courteous and attentive. Overall a very pleasant experience. Definitely would eat here again.

name: Spice Restaurant & Bar Bedale
text: A beautiful meal. Service was amazing. We got a banquet meal for ¬£14.99 per person and it was worth it. Really enjoyed it

name: Spice Restaurant & Bar Bedale
text: Food was lovely and waiters very friendly. Would definitely go back again

name: ABP Food Group
text: As a HGV driver u will spend more time waiting then u can imagine, and that's how is looks like them HGV waiting area. At all not too bid, bit the time here is just ......

name: ABP Food Group
text: Dale food is also stored here. Correct, clean, humane warehouse. Acceptance of the price takes time. You have to be patient here.

name: McDonald's
text: Set within Leeming bar services I've called in many times and always had good service. Busy at peak times but good service and plenty of parking. Always found the place clean including the toilets. Handy location, follow the signs for Leeming bar services and take the road running parallel to the A1 north.

name: McDonald's
text: Another McDonalds, this time for breakfast - kids were keen, and actually I usually prefer the McD's breakfast.... this one is situated at the services, although when I say services I use the term loosely as the McD's has it's own separate building set round the back. If you mistakingly park in the normal car park then you have to walk all way round. It's not clear when you drive into services that the McD's has its own car park with drive thru.  Machines to order were a bit 50/50, the place was fairly busy which also meant a small wait, but also what appeared to be grumpy staff! Not a major issue, just wasn't a great experience and another McD's with no real soul or anything that stands out to differentiate it from any others.

name: McDonald's
text: Above average Maccies. Food hot and fast helpful polite staff. Clean and Maccies armchairs. Went at 13.30 on a Friday and it was surprisingly quiet

name: McDonald's
text: Fries were grainy as they were clearly made from poor quality potatoes, triple cheeseburger was dry and bun was old. Ordered two apple pies and was told to wait for them, then the bag was brought out and didn‚Äôt have any apple pies in! Absolutely ridiculous never coming back to this godforsaken McDonald‚Äôs ever again and would recommend anyone else to avoid it like the plague.

name: McDonald's
text: I need to say that my first AND only visit to this place was over a year ago now and it was truly DIRE!  The place and surrounding was really scruffy and very untidy and as for the actual meal - UNBELIEVABLE - if this rubbish was served up in America they would be kicked out of the country for treating customers with contempt!  The double  cheeseburger was a fraction of the size it used to be, tasted like something from a garbage can, with very very little dressing (lettuce etc) it would not have filled a baby mouse, i was truly disgusted by the amount, the whole thing was on the cold side!  After 10 minutes i was ready for something to eat, I would honestly say that this nranch is THE worst in ENGLAND but after this visit i have absolutely no wish to travel the country sampling outdated branches with ppor examples of the famous Mcdonald meals - truly gruesome experience Maccys

name: The Reubens
text: We stopped off for just one night after a long drive from Devon on the way to Edinburgh. This was such a welcoming place with lovely staff. We arrived too late for a meal but we had messaged ahead and there were plates of delicious salad and sandwiches waiting for us. The room we booked was small but really comfortable with a great shower and a very comfortable bed. Everything was clean and fresh. The location is really close to the A1 so it's extremely handy but quiet too. We had no time to explore the area but there are some lovely spots around there.

name: The Reubens
text: We stayed here Sat 19.11.22 after visiting the Polar Express attraction which was around the corner. Lovely place! the staff were all really friendly, the food was excellent and the room really nice.  Thank you, might see you again next year for Polar Express round 2 :)

name: The Reubens
text: The staff at the Rubens made a special family affair very very special indeed. Extremely grateful thanks to Sandra and her team for accommodating the Scullys and Thompsons in such splendid fashion. The food and service were impeccable, and it was a joy to enjoy such a special afternoon. Have a lovely Christmas all of you and thanks again.

name: The Reubens
text: Got a take away Sunday dinner as we were poorly, it was a hot delicious  treat. Good sized portion well packed up.

name: The Reubens
text: The hotl was OK, but no windows in the room made it really claustrophobic. The staff around the breakfast tables were really nice.

name: ABP Wessex Foods
text: Went with work not bad

name: ABP Wessex Foods
text: Do not buy there quarter pounder burgers they are really bad.

name: ABP Wessex Foods
text: Got be the worst place I have ever tipped in a while worse

name: ABP Wessex Foods
text: Love it

name: ABP Wessex Foods
text: Slow Downey bastards 6 hour tip

name: Black Sheep Brewery
text: Fantastic place to visit, very informative tour guide. Lovely beers to finish off with. My wife and I chose to have three thirds of a pint tasters. The guide and the barman helped us make our choices which were perfect. After sampling the three we went to the on site shop to purchase some of their lovely beers. Hope to have a return trip in the spring

name: Black Sheep Brewery
text: Fabulous trip. We booked a tour at 11.30am for 1 hour, the guide spoke about how the brewery started and walked the group around the brewery. We had a tasting session and for those that didn't participate in the sampling there was a free bottle to take out. We had lunch there too and spent some time in the merchandise shop. Definitely worth a visit very enjoyable.

name: Black Sheep Brewery
text: Excellent drinks and food. Good atmosphere, friendly staff and service. Plenty of tables and worth booking if you're eating. Excellent selection of beers and craft ales. Really pleased they have gluten free options available for drinks and food. Gluten free drinks are their cider on draught or Wold Top Against the Grain and Daura. Overall an excellent experience. They also offer tours and have a shop on site. Highly recommended.

name: Black Sheep Brewery
text: As per other people the tour guide was really informative and engaging. The bar is a good place for a drink after though could do with a few more seats in that area. There are plenty in the restaurant area. Tour is a learning experience but they could be a little more generous with the vouchers. One pint is probably the least amount I‚Äôve had on a tour though admittedly none of those have been in the UK. Recommend.

name: Black Sheep Brewery
text: Where do I start with this review?  What a welcoming bunch of people who run this place! From the charming and engaging tour guide Bronwyn (a near 80 year old veteran of 25 years), to the friendly and helpful lads behind the bar at the end.  They really made the experience for us, without them it would have still been an interesting tour, learning about the history of the place and the brewing process etc, but it's clear they love being a part of a real local treasure.  Would highly recommend for anyone who likes beer as you get to sample any variety you want at the end and knowing the care they've put in to it just makes you enjoy it more!  Being a 'demand only' brewery (they don't stockpile to avoid adding preservatives) they've also been hammered by the forced closure of pubs over the last 2 years, so they really need the support of visitors and new customers.  Great value, highly recommend!

name: Samuels Restaurant
text: We always have a Sunday lunch here when we are in Yorkshire, wonderful old building with magnificent grounds. With the accomplish cooking and friendly service it is a pleasure to spend some time in this establishment. After missing a few visits because of the pandemic lock downs, it was good to see some old faces again.

name: Samuels Restaurant
text: The setting and the staff are absolutely fantastic. The food in Samuels is unfortunately very over priced and not very good. Disappointing considering the other facilities and offerings at this place are amazing.

name: Samuels Restaurant
text: Fantastic new head chef offering a brilliant seasonal tasting menu...  We had a beautiful evening in great surroundings. The hotel is gradually being refurbished and when finished will match the quality of the food.  Our only feedback for our tasting menu was our main course of lamb. We felt it either needed to be bigger or presented on a smaller plate. Unfortunately it was a little lost in a sea of porcelain!  Overall a lovely evening and we hope the new head chef brings success to the hotel.

name: Harry's Traditional Fish and Chips
text: Absolutely beautiful! Crispy batter, non greasy & great portion size! The best we've had in a very long time. Curry sauce was fab too! Friendly & helpful staff. Would definitely come again, worth the 1.5hr drive üòÅ

name: Harry's Traditional Fish and Chips
text: First time trying here and not disappointed. Delicious fish and chips, fish fresh and not too heavily battered, chips chunky. Generous portion and great service

name: Harry's Traditional Fish and Chips
text: Average fish and chips. Fish was rather oily although chips were good. Suspect the oil needed changing.

name: Harry's Traditional Fish and Chips
text: Excellent fish and chips. Well fried and nice and dry. Not the cheapest around - perhaps because it's the only fish restaurant in the area?

name: Harry's Traditional Fish and Chips
text: Staying locally and tried Harry‚Äôs tonight. Wonderful fish and chips with wonderful service! Highly recommend ü§©

name: The Wensleydale Hotel
text: We would like to thank Fiona and the rest of the staff for making our stay over the New Year an enjoyable experience. We stayed for 3 nights with our dog and were made to feel welcome. Its nice to find a hotel that makes dogs welcome as well.  The room was comfortable and the food and service from all of the staff was excellent. The location of the Wensleydale is great for exploring the area. We would definitely recommend.

name: The Wensleydale Hotel
text: five of us had lunch today at the Tack room. We had four times Scallops and my husband had the Sea Bream and Samphire. We started our lunch with a bottle of Prosecco and moved on to a Vignonier (sp?) with the fish. We rounded off our meal with various  moorish deserts . I had tarte Tatine and icecream Every plate looked classy and appetising. The scallops were fragrant and aromatic and the Sea Bream had perfect crispy skin. The whole experience smacked of class and taste in both senses of the word!. It was the sort of taste that lingers with you after you leave. HIghly recommended if you value taste and imagination over a blow out.

name: The Wensleydale Hotel
text: Stayed for many overnight stays in the dales with my wife,. I found the room ok, cleanliness ok as well. Overall you guessed it, just ok. One thing as a drawback was the price of a room for a night. Quite expensive at 140 double & 180 twin inc brekkie. 7/10 for me.

name: The Wensleydale Hotel
text: Just returned home after a short stay of 2 nights. Lovely hotel, my single room was delightful. Had evening meal on both evenings in the Tack room. The service was spot on and what can I say about the food, just putting delicious would not do it justice.  It was perfect, sea bream the first evening and Lamb rump the next. The staff are so friendly and welcoming.  Definitely recommend staying there.

name: The Wensleydale Hotel
text: We visited Middleham for lunch one Sunday and what a find the Wensleydale hotel proved to be. We thought there was a French feel to it and as the owners have lived and worked in France , not surprising. We had a 3 course meal from the set menu, and it was delicious, one of the best meals we have ever had. Although we live some miles away, we plan to return.

name: Restaurant EightyEight
text: I did not have high expectations for this Asian urban club lounge style restaurant completely out of context in a basement in the Yorkshire countryside... But... It blew me away. Dining in London you have your pick of upscale Asian cuisine so I was jaded for sure... But let me tell you, it was well worth the visit. Arriving at Grantley Hall it's an impressive and beautiful place and the modern new building where 88 sits is sexy and inviting. The cocktails are interesting and some delicious. The service good. The food however, is a labour of love in its own right. We had the tasting menu...opting for the standard and one vegan for variety and shared almost everything. To the chef I say bravo, your dishes were inspired and original. The chicken broth wow, the Korean fried cauliflower wow, the clay pot tofu (cannot believe I'm saying this... Wow), the celeriac in masterstock ...wow. the rhubarb sorbet wow. Both menus were equal and I have never said that about vegan food so last night was an education in vegan for me in the art of the possible. Mind blown and will not be forgotten soon. Thank you!!

name: Restaurant EightyEight
text: We've had a wonderful evening at the EightyEight, the tasting menus (both regular and vegan) and drinks were absolutely delicious, I really appreciated that the vegan menu is its own, thought out, menu and that the dishes were served at a good pace and portion sizes were just right. The ambience was great as well, with every single person we encountered being friendly and professional. What set this place apart for me was the attention to detail that was evident at every step.

name: Restaurant EightyEight
text: As the other reviews state: Tasting menu - creative amazing flavours. Perfectly cooked and came as a complete surprise. Service - attentive,  knowledgeable, engaging and pacing of the meal was bang on. Atmosphere - unobtrusive music, fun decor based on its asian themes and well spaced tables so you are not condemned to hear every conversation in your ear. We have eaten in many Michelin starred restaurants and this did a lot better than most.  With 8 courses even though I was full, I didn't want it to end. A perfect evening.

name: Restaurant EightyEight
text: An absolutely fantastic evening, beautiful food, amazing service and fantastic atmosphere and decor.  Tai, was an absolute star who looked after us all evening, he is an absolute credit to himself and Grantley Hall.  This Restaurant is without doubt worthy of a Michelin star - we have had the good fortune to have eaten at some high end restaurants and this most definitely was as good - it was one of the best meals that we have had.  Thank you to everyone at Restaurant 88 for making my 50th Birthday so very special.  We hope to be back very soon.  Michael and Claire

name: Restaurant EightyEight
text: We dined here last Saturday with 2 friends, it's our 4th time. because we love it. However, 3 of us had the tasting menu and my wife choose scallops for starter and the halibut for main. The halibut was overcooked and dry and was the same size as our taster and at ¬£32 I believe the chef made an error. My wife told the waiter the halibut was dry, and he said he would tell the chef but did not return to offer her a replacement and we were charged the full ¬£32, she didn't return it because she didn't wish to hold up the rest of us. Sadly disappointed.

name: Swinton Bivouac
text: Went here to visit the Druids temple beautiful area and very peaceful. lots of walking route's. You can park in the field before Swinton Bivouac and there is an honesty box to pay for parking ¬£3.

name: Swinton Bivouac
text: Such a rip off for basic products. Two soft drinks (cans of pop) and a coffee was nearly ¬£9. Then the latte turned up the size of an espresso. So glad we didn't eat here

name: Swinton Bivouac
text: We ordered soup and a bacon roll and we waited around 40 minutes for it to be served. The soup was really disappointing and the bacon roll looked absolutely nothing like the standard of food on the photos, these must have been taken sometime ago. Coffee was lovely. Toilets were extremely smelly and weren't looked after. There was a bowl of water down for dogs which looked like it hadn't been changed for days.

name: Swinton Bivouac
text: Limited menu due to staff shortages so only had sandwiches, burgers or a few starters. The food was very nice and brought quickly. The staff are super friendly. I would have rated higher if we had the full menu. It was also quite cold and the doors were open.

name: Swinton Bivouac
text: Food was really good at the Bivouac Cafe. Had the Buttermilk Chicken Burger and could not be happier. Good atmosphere and area. You are able to view the birds of prey that they have there.

name: The Queen's Head, Finghall
text: From the moment we arrived to a warm, welcoming smile we felt at home. The accommodation was spotless, clean and tidy. The service was faultless and friendly. We ate in the restaurant on our first night and the food was delicious with superb service. The breakfast was particularly good (the eggs were from across the road and the sausages were FANTASTIC) once again served with a friendly, professional and welcoming smile. We will be back! Thank you.

name: The Queen's Head, Finghall
text: Hidden Gem! This pub totally surprised me. I made a booking based on the photos of the food above ^     It ended up smashing my expectations of the place. A very well put together menu with amazing food to suit, polite and friendly staff and a cheerful atmosphere.

name: The Queen's Head, Finghall
text: Really nice people, mouth watering menu, excellent allergy advice. 6 of us had lunch there after a lovely walk along the Moor Beck. We came away very well fed. We strongly recommend the potted crab, also mussels, also samphire and shrimp samosas. For main course, we recommend the chicken with pie crust, also the pork belly.

name: The Queen's Head, Finghall
text: Good  food  lots of choice for  everyone  we had rabbit  pasta   and  chicken and ham pie  both very good

name: The Queen's Head, Finghall
text: Stopped in for a Sunday evening meal. It was absolutely lovely, the food was delicious - great Sunday roast and I had the asparagus and mushroom pasta. Great views while we ate and a really relaxing atmosphere. Would definitely go back

name: Bordar House Teas
text: What lovely, friendly and obliging staff, very cheerful and helpful. Prime site overlooking the market square in Masham. I had a green tea and a banana milkshake, the latter which they don't normally proffer for takeout. Has some outdoor seating on the pavement. I also had the most scrummiest fruit and cherry flapjack which was quite moist - went down well with the sparrows and the blackbirds too who were foraging for their young. Would definitely call here again and can still taste that lovely flapjack. Yum!

name: Bordar House Teas
text: Good home cooked food and excellent service, even thou they were very busy . My baked potato and prawns were yummy ! üëç

name: Bordar House Teas
text: Fabulous!!!! Best free range eggs ever. Real value for money and great staff. Mind you, you will likely have to wait for a seat as it's very popular......and well earned.

name: Bordar House Teas
text: Had a brilliantly tasty Brie, bacon and cranberry panini and latte for lunch along with a large latte, really great and so fresh üëç üòã will be back next time in Masham as is was such a wonderful day sat outside

name: Bordar House Teas
text: Very good service and you can see into a clean and organised kitchen. Victoria sponge cake and the milkshakes were delicious.

name: Wensleydale Heifer
text: Fantastic themed rooms. A good menu, lots of choices with the emphasis on fish. A small but well stocked bar. The desserts are artistry on a plate. All the staff are cheery, polite and helpful. My wife and I have stayed many times, we are always welcomed back, treated like honoured guests, made to feel individually special. We always feel excited and ready for another visit!

name: Wensleydale Heifer
text: Fantastic from start to finish.  A nice initial touch with a ‚ÄúHappy Anniversary‚Äù balloon, followed by some great service. We were made to feel really welcome, the staff chatted to our daughter and the dog.  The food was excellent, we were really impressed!  We will definitely be back!

name: Wensleydale Heifer
text: Very nice hotel and the food was excellent. We had the gin room which was a little smaller than expected and without double glazing could be a tad cool when the temperature dropped outside. Better quality toilet roll would have been nice also a box of tissues would have been a welcome addition to the room. Food wise the hotel could not be faulted as every meal we had was superb and real quality. The staff are very friendly and helpful which made our short stay very enjoyable and we are very likely to return at some point as the area is absolutely fantastic.

name: Wensleydale Heifer
text: Came for dinner. Staggeringly overpriced for what it is. The food was fine, but not great, and would be reasonable at half the price. For comparison Bentley‚Äôs in central London - a bastion of high-end seafood - is cheaper, as well as being notably better. The service was attentive and friendly, and it was booked solid on a weekday evening so they‚Äôre still doing a roaring trade at this quality and price point.

name: Wensleydale Heifer
text: Booked here last week - on the "Beat the Blues" deal. We had eaten here about 3 years ago one day for lunch , and we enjoyed, but the experience of staying over and having an evening meal was not good. Stayed in the Four Poster Room, which looks lovely and pink, and bright, and fresh on the photos, but in reality is not pink, or bright, very dull decor, tired looking, small, creaky, limited space , uneven wardrobe. The rooms are really close together , narrow stairway, noisy. Evening meal - Looked at the menu for our voucher - wasn't anything that sounded exciting so partner went for the so called named "controversial" lobster salad which was ¬£40. It had arrived and he was wondering where the lobster had gone, because the end bits of the claw was the only meat, very small scallops that were supposed to be king, so they kindly sent over an extra portion. The ambience in the restaurant, well, just wasn't any atmosphere at all. Very dim lit, with what felt like an old folks home.  No personality to it. Over priced drinks, which seems to be a common theme on these reviews, and totally agree with the chap who said they are obviously trading by their reputation, because for ¬£280 there are many many other places to visit, and get a much better quality stay.  Sat at breakfast - unprofessional staff, had to listen to the cleaner saying how mucky some people are as someone had left a bathroom dirty -

name: The Saddle Room Restaurant
text: Lovely location, spectacular views from the grounds. Nice conversion from the original stables to accommodation and restaurant. The food was nice, but I would say a little overpriced. Service was good.

name: The Saddle Room Restaurant
text: Exceptional sunday roast, very high quality, big portions of all the trimmings. Great value too, especially if going the three course option.

name: The Saddle Room Restaurant
text: Booked a couple of nights stay B&B plus an evening meal as we had tickets for The Forbidden Corner. What can I say? A fantastic experience all round. Room lovely, food exceptional and attraction amazing. Pleasantly surprised by the cost of food and drink - no over charging because you are miles from anywhere - and it was all good quality and locally sourced (I believe). We will definitely stay here again if we come back to the area. It would be daft not to!

name: The Saddle Room Restaurant
text: Just what you want for a Sunday lunch! Our group had the lamb, beef and veggie nut roast and all of them were very tasty - lots of veg and huge Yorkshire puddings. Good choice of starters and puds too. Friendly staff and good prices. üëç

name: The Saddle Room Restaurant
text: I have just spent 2 nights in one of the B & B rooms, as well as stopping for christmas dinner with the family! It was amazing! Room nice, clean and comfortable! Food totally amazing and the staff could not be more helpful! We even had a delivery from Santa who left a very thoughtful stocking on my bedroom door! Wish I could have stopped longer and enjoyed the beautiful grounds! Highly recommended x PS breakfast yummy with loads of local products

name: Queens Head
text: Very filling pizza. Relaxed atmosphere. Accommodating to dogs. Great price. Thanks

name: Queens Head
text: Amazing food super generous portions of food but all good quality and well seasoned and cooked. Quite a few gluten free options. Super dog friendly and really nice landlord and staff. Can't reccomend highly enough.

name: Queens Head
text: Great food,  enough beef in the steak and ale pie to defeat most diners!

name: Queens Head
text: Timothy Taylor Landlord perfect and probably the best Gammon and chips I've had in a long time.

name: Queens Head
text: A traditional pub with superb hosts. Beer kept and poured superbly. We had a Sunday Roast dinner with super generous portions. We all left very happy.

name: Three Horse Shoes
text: We popped in for lunch on Saturday and it‚Äôs a brilliant place to visit. The food was delicious, there was a good atmosphere, the staff are very attentive and friendly. We‚Äôll definitely visit when we are back in the area again üòÉ

name: Three Horse Shoes
text: Very homely feel to the pub,friendly and helpful service and great traditional pub grub. The home made steak and Ale Pie was  gorgeous üòãüòã!! Will be back again.

name: Three Horse Shoes
text: Great pub. Good selection of beers, great homemade food and friendly staff. Also dog friendly which is handy. Can highly recommend

name: Three Horse Shoes
text: Only stopped for a pint mid-walk and the weather was good enough to sit outside but the pub seemed quite pleasant and the food seemed popular. Wensleydale Semer Water and Theakstons Best both very good.

name: Three Horse Shoes
text: Lovely little dog friendly stop on our walk. Only stayed for drinks, which were fine, and staff were absolutely lovely.

name: The Galphay Inn
text: First time calling at The Galphay Inn on Sunday and I wasn't disappointed! The leek and potato soup was absolutely delicious, served with warm crusty bread and butter which just had me dipping my bread straight in! Followed that with a fabulous steak and ale pie served with proper chips and vegetables. Washed down with a pot of tea as I was driving (to be fair I'd probably still have a cup of tea even if I wasn't üòÇ) cracking pub with lovely food and friendly service. Will definitely be back

name: The Galphay Inn
text: Sunday lunch at the Galphay Inn...brilliant!  Friendly, welcoming atmosphere, delicious food..huge portions. Historic inn set in an absolutely delightful village. Looking forward to our next visit.

name: The Galphay Inn
text: Just enjoyed a wonderful meal in The Galphay Inn for New Year. Very friendly staff, lovely pint and exceptional food. Highly recommend a visit.

name: The Galphay Inn
text: We had Sunday lunch here today. It was fantastic! Both the roast pork and beef we're delicious, as we're the trimmings. The hospitality and service were brilliant., and very reasonably priced, the terrace at the back was pretty, with lots of shaded areas for our black lab. Speaking of dogs......when we got back to the car, there was a used dog poo bag at the side! Who ever did this should be ashamed of themselves!!!!! Disgusting!!! Jayne, Terry and Alfie

name: The Galphay Inn
text: There is a good vegetarian menu as well as good quality pub food at a reasonable price. The service was excellent. A friendly place

name: Halls Fish & Chips
text: Used to eat here quite often with my dad. Food was always very good and staff were pleasant and cheerful. What a difference recently when we called on a Saturday lunch time to find the cafe completely empty. A girl came through to take our order, she didn't speak and seemed that it was a chore to serve. We both had fish and chips. Chips were fine but the fish was very poor quality as was the batter. I hope that this was a one off but judging by the empty cafe I don't think it was. We were the only people in the whole time we were there. Not what you would expect on a Saturday lunch time.

name: Halls Fish & Chips
text: When the fish and chips were wrapped up.  I thought l had only been given chips.  Opened them up to see tiny piece of fish. Will not waste my money going here again.  If they think a sprat for fish is acceptable.   They need to see what decent chip shops provide. Very Expensive for what you get.

name: Halls Fish & Chips
text: I had been looking forward to trying the Cod and Chips given the positive reviews. I was very disappointed!  The fish was very small which I get everything has become more expensive. However the fish didn't taste very fresh, it was VERY fishy tasting and chips were overly greasy! I had 1 bite of the fish and couldn't touch it anymore.  Sadly the staff who served me were not very welcoming, didn't say hello and just glared the whole time. As someone who despises being told to smile constantly, it is not something I would ever say to someone but equally I do not expect to be made to feel unwelcome by being glared at!

name: Halls Fish & Chips
text: There's better out there I won't lie, did the job though and good prices. Unfortunately the chips were a bit dry and the sauces underwhelming but I'd probably go back if I fancied a chippy so

name: Halls Fish & Chips
text: Went  yesterday good Friday, Spot on don‚Äôt read the reviews 7 of us  had them and they were spot on.

name: Three Coopers
text: My partner & I stayed there one weekend. We had a lovely clean room, comfy bed, was peaceful, great shower too! In the evening we enjoyed a meal in the town then back to the three coopers for drinks, lovely landlord & landlady there, made us feel very welcome in their warm friendly establishment, as did their friendly doggies too!. In the morning we had a BIG breakfast which was cooked to perfection & got us started for the day, we always pop back for a visit whenever we are in the area this our local when away from home

name: Three Coopers
text: Very friendly, clean and tidy. Great value for money. Made to feel at home even in the bar where I was able to watch what I wanted and given the remote!! Wait till you meet the most beautiful dogs. I‚Äôd have taken one home except she was too heavyü§£

name: Three Coopers
text: I have stayed here on a few occasions while working in the area. It‚Äôs a lovely little pub, with great friendly staff. I‚Äôve always been made welcome with the locals as well. Well recommended

name: Three Coopers
text: Rob & Sara are tremendous hosts nothing is a bother accommodation excellent. The food is brilliant and a great pint of beer. Always get good service and always made welcome. A++++++

name: Three Coopers
text: Really quirky pub, decor amazing something for everyone,  beer and cider great, very friendly and welcoming atmosphere,  adorable dogs

name: The White Bear
text: We celebrated our 50th birthday's with a meal and drinks at the venue with close friends who all live out of area. The communication in planning the event before the date was brilliant with Sue being really responsive on email. The service on the day was outstanding. Staff were very attentive. The food was outstanding. Without a doubt the best experience we have had with eating out. Would highly recommend  and we will be back in the future - Mrs Lawrence from Sussex

name: The White Bear
text: My sister and I were staying close by and came here for dinner on a Sunday. We both had Sunday Roast. The vegetables were fresh and delicious with a good size home made yorkshire pudding. We both had a dessert. I had raspberry parfait and it was delicious. My sister had Apple crumble with ice cream, she also said that was really good. The service here was excellent by every member of staff we encountered, a credit to The White Bear. I would highly recommend this place.

name: The White Bear
text: Took a twin room and had a great breakfast. The rooms are a good size and bathrooms well fitted. The bathroom bits and pieces mean you don‚Äôt need to bring anything. Welcoming staff and very good service. Would go again for sure.

name: The White Bear
text: Really lovely warm and friendly pub. Looking exceptionally festive right now. At least two beautiful and well behaved pub dogs, the staff were so helpful and accommodating with our annoying and last minute requests. The food is delicious, generous portions and the beer is very well kept.

name: The White Bear
text: Beautiful room with exquisite bathroom. The food was excellent.But above all the staff made our weekend so special. They were so welcoming and friendly.. Highly recommended

name: Kings Head Hotel
text: We had a great two night stay at The King's Head, staying in room 20 (in the rear courtyard) along with our two dogs. The room was lovely, very clean and tastefully decorated and plenty big enough especially with the mezzanine bedroom. Breakfast each morning was very good, even more so with the excellent service provided by the wonderful Gaye and Mandy. Jet and Jasper really appreciated the sausage each morning! The village of Masham is delightful, with loads of walks to follow and some lovely pubs with great beers (as you'd expect really with two renowned breweries on the doorstep!) and great food.

name: Kings Head Hotel
text: Really friendly and helpful. No food available which we were politely informed as soon as we entered. Only stayed for one pint but would be happy to go again as it was very pleasant. It was especially nice to see a Greene King bar serving local ales (or any draft ales for that matter as ours is terrible and only has bottles and cans).

name: Kings Head Hotel
text: We were a party of 4 booked in to stay the night. One of the rooms was in the hotel and was lovely, very spacious and very comfortable bed. The ensure was spacious and nicely decorated. The other room was in the courtyard area and again was a beautiful spacious room with the added character of beams. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and we hope to go back again.

name: Kings Head Hotel
text: Had a very over night stay, after a little mix up at check in which was rectified straight away. Booked in for an evening meal which was superb, will definitely recommend the Sunday dinner, fresh and very tasty. We had a room outside in the courtyard which was great. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel, great rooms, food and beers, staff were attentive and helpful. You couldn't ask for anything more really.

name: Kings Head Hotel
text: We had a fabulous midweek break. The room was clean and very comfortable. The bar service was good. The food at dinner was delicious. The breakfast service was enhanced by the chat and service given by Chris and Gaye, who couldn't do enough to ensure we had everything we wanted.

name: The Lunchbox
text: Stopped here for some lunch after a recommendation. Went for the daily special - chicken curry. The food was ok. Biggest gripe - it took 20 mins from ordering to getting my food. Wished i had gone for a sarnie. I had to rush the curry when i got back to work as lunch break is only 30 mins!

name: The Lunchbox
text: Good quality food. In a great location Masham market Square.

name: The Lunchbox
text: So we popped into the lunchbox for a sandwich and the women in there were soooo kind and friendly!! We had our dog with us and they let us bring him in!! The kind lady‚Äôs also gave us a sausage for our dog ( I offered to pay but she did not accept that shows the kindness  of these lady‚Äôs) my husband could not make a decision on what cake he wanted so decided to get all three on offer!! Food was great and would happily go back!!! Thank you lady‚Äôs and Morris loved his sausage!!!

name: The Lunchbox
text: Amazing food, staff are so lovely. Their cakes are unbelievable too üòç  Highly recommend the breakfast box to anyone!

name: The Lunchbox
text: Great menu, realistically priced and staff not so bad either, my regular lunch stop when I'm working in Masham.. If you haven't tried them, give em a go, tell em Dave Sent you!

name: The Bruce Arms
text: Outstanding vegan food - definitely the best Sunday lunch we have had anywhere. A delicious meal, really well-balanced and no compromise on flavour. So many dessert options including a cheese board. Great service and very knowledgeable. Looking forward to our next meal there!

name: The Bruce Arms
text: Fantastic couple of nights here! Highly recommend paying The Bruce Arms a visit for a pint, meal or night away. The food was fantastic, and Matt was a great host for the weekend. We each enjoyed the smoked bacon loin and lamb cannon. The sticky toffee pudding - what a treat!! The menu changes every couple of weeks or so, so you can be sure to get something seasonal. The breakfast was fab! Great local butcher‚Äôs produce. Some may say the food is not the cheapest, but hey, you get what you pay for. The Bruce seems to be on the up with the owners wanting to build up their business which is great to see and support. We will be back!!

name: The Bruce Arms
text: Lovely place for a night away celebrating our anniversary. The room was comfortable and clean with everything you needed. The food in the restaurant was gorgeous for both our evening meal and breakfast and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Service from Matt and his team was impeccable throughout our stay, we'll definitely be back!!

name: The Bruce Arms
text: Nice little country pub with a real fire. Seating is a bit limited unless you are eating, in which case the restaurant should suffice. It's probably best to book ahead. Excellent ales on tap with friendly bar staff. Mental note to have a meal next visit.

name: The Bruce Arms
text: Visited here on New Year's Eve for lunch together with a return visit on 22nd January for Sunday lunch. Both times were excellent, and was the reason for our return visit. A great location, great service, dog-friendly and a good selection of drinks and real ales. The food was amazing and had the 'Chicken + Ham Pie with Triple Cooked Chips' on my first visit followed by a 'Christmas Sticky Toffee Pudding'. The Sunday lunch is still the best that I have had so far this year. Had 'Roast chicken breast, sausage meat + bacon' followed by 'Lemon posset, raspberries, and cumin shortbread'. Simply divine food and will definitely recommend and return

name: The Sawley Arms
text: We stopped off for lunch as we were passing by. The pub was fairly quiet, except for Smooth FM cranking out some classic tunes.  The menu was good, a few veggie options with a distinct nod to pub classics. Service was also good, friendly and attentive.  The food portions were generous. On the whole, the food was good, aside from a slight aftertaste with the chips.  A service charge of 10% is included. This was pointed out when paying. This felt a little excessive for a pub lunch.

name: The Sawley Arms
text: Our first night in the Dales. We arrived without reservation on a Friday evening however the owner and hostess welcomed us and made us feel like a local, offering advice and guidance on things to see and do whilst in the Dales. Food was great. Portions are hearty - different from our usual London sizes. Highly recommend the fish and chips. Will be back.

name: The Sawley Arms
text: Fabulous food in a friendly welcoming atmosphere. 10 of us enjoyed a delicious pre-Christmas meal in a beautifully and tastefully decorated dining room in the pub restaurant. Staff were most welcoming and very professional. The food was expertly prepared, tasted superb and the portions were very generous. Definitely the best traditional English meal I have had for a number of years. Would not hesitate to recommend The Sawley Arms;  you will not be disappointed. I am eagerly looking forward to my next visit and will plan to stay overnight to experience the great hospitality on offer.

name: The Sawley Arms
