text: Great service and very accommodating. The food in the pub was really good as was the service. The family room we stayed in was very modern, clean and had everything we needed. We will definitely stay here again when visiting the area.

name: The Sawley Arms
text: Great village pub serving great beer and good food staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The small rooms give this place a great atmosphere and it's dog friendly! Even if you are eating, just let them know you are bringing a dog and the set a table in the conservatory which is very comfortable. Lovely warm place well worth a visit with some interesting Walks close by and only 5 minutes drive from #fountainsabbey. Ten minutes from Brimham rocks.  They served food from breakfast till about 9.

name: Where There's Smoke Restaurant
text: We had an excellent meal here. The food was wonderful - excellent range of flavours that were really well balanced throughout each course. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated and has a lovely atmosphere. The chef clearly knows how to cook exceptionally well. If I had one suggestion for an improvement it would be the name. It suggests something serving lots of grilled or flame cooked food whereas this is high-quality fine dining with little evidence of 'smoke'. It really doesn't do justice to the great experience you get at the restaurant.

name: Where There's Smoke Restaurant
text: My partner and I had a wonderful evening at WTS, the tasting menu was delicious paired with a wine recommended by restaurant manager, John.  All food served beautifully in pottery made by the head chef, Jon.  We had the opportunity to thank Jon at the end of the evening too.  Good food, excellent service, amazing attention to detail.  This was a dining experience, not just a meal.  We found the restaurant via the Michelin website, a well earned spot in their recommendations.  We wish this restaurant every success!

name: Where There's Smoke Restaurant
text: Exceptional. Every dish excited us upon tasting. Rare to find something truly different. Service joyful. Charming touch to eat from pottery dishes & the wood table crafted by the chef himself. An underestimated delight. Thoroughly recommend. We will travel a long way to enjoy this visit again.

name: Where There's Smoke Restaurant
text: OMG What an absolutely wonderful experience.  The food was outstanding and catered for my lactose intolerance.  Loved the atmosphere , the decoration was beautiful . The staff were so attentative . Cannot fault anything and will definitely return . Thank you.

name: Where There's Smoke Restaurant
text: A lovely experience!  The whole evening felt special.  Food was delicious (we were a mix of meat eaters and non red meat eaters). Ambience was super. Staff were professional and informative.  John really looked after us and Jon the chef popped to chat.  A really lovely evening. Thank you.

name: Rock House Farm
text: I had the wonderful opportunity to visit Rock House Farm and meet the beautiful family that runs it.  All the hard work, dedication and love they pour on to the land and the farm is inspiring.  And that care that goes into their products and goods, the deliciousness of their jams made it to Puerto Rico and Las Vegas, NV (USA).  We savored every teaspoon and were left wanting more.  We might be far away but for a moment we had a taste of Rock House Farm Kitchen and, OH how good it was.  Thank you!!

name: Rock House Farm
text: Lovely farm shop run by family business from locally sourced produce. Organically run farm - great fun to visit (see Airbnb Experiences for a fantastic afternoon at the farm)

name: Rock House Farm
text: Wonderful family business. We had a tour of the lambing shed and saw how well these animals are all cared for. Purchased among other things their pork chops which we've cooked tonight. They were absolutely amazing, full of flavour and not expensive. Looking forward to trying the lamb shanks and steak another night. Would highly recommend a visit.

name: Rock House Farm
text: David and Sheena, First of all, we had an amazing time visiting Rock House Farm this afternoon. Your family was so gracious to let us come visit with your brand new baby cow and many little new born lambs. It was a real pleasure meeting you all, learning about your family farm‚Äôs history and experiencing the day-to-day operations of a working family farm. Secondly, we had the lamb and mint burgers we purchased from your farm shop for dinner, and they were outstanding. Easily the best lamb burgers we have ever had! Thanks again and we look forward to visiting the farm shop for more excellent meats, jams, fudge and wood products. Definitely, well worth the trip!

name: Rock House Farm
text: We had the best morning at Rock House Farm, thank you! Tom and Laura taught us alot on our tour and the children loved every minute! The family are clearly so passionate about farming the right way and providing the best care for their animals! The farm shop has some fantastic produce, we bought the tastiest sausages we have ever eaten, high quality, locally produced meat means low impact on the environment which is so important to us. Such a gorgeous, family run business, so glad we have found you!

name: The Grantley Bar & Restaurant
text: A lovely friendly village pub.  Myself and three friends visited the pub for an evening meal on Friday 16th September.  We were very surprised by the excellent quality of the food and the attentive service provided by the very friendly waitress and barman.  Despite not being local to the village we were made to feel at home and were glad to spend our evening there.  Our only disappointment was the opening hours on the Saturday afternoon- you missed a few people calling in for a pint after we squeezed in for last orders!  We look forward to visiting the pub again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good solid local.  Thanks again for a lovely evening.

name: The Grantley Bar & Restaurant
text: The affable Eric is the quintessential welcoming landlord with a friendly chat and informality that makes you immediately at your ease. The food had to be pre ordered but that only added to the anticipation of well cooked tasty fair at middling prices. The young server was polite and attentive and deserved a tip if only for the ridicule she endured due her lack of direction....

name: The Grantley Bar & Restaurant
text: Booked for Sunday lunch, lovely hosts. Inside is beautifully laid out with outdoor areas both front & back. Very welcoming, great menu. You can tell the food is local because it tastes so fresh. Highly recommended.

name: The Grantley Bar & Restaurant
text: Very nice cooked fresh on order. Expensive but worth it

name: The Grantley Bar & Restaurant
text: Nice food well cooked. Want aware of the cast wandering around the restaurant until it appeared on the ledge at the side of my face. Cute if you like cats and the hairs that go with them in your dining area? Some do I don't!  Beers good well kept much more of an eatery than a pub.

name: The Orchard at Grantley Hall
text: Outstanding location for lunch. It felt so warm and welcoming with twinkly lights and fur throws. Delicious informal food but with outstanding service and attention to detail. Thank you to everyone for looking after us so well at lunch today.

name: The Orchard at Grantley Hall
text: Like nothing I've experienced before, outstanding place to visit. Food at the orchard was OK, but this was all about the experience.

name: The Orchard at Grantley Hall
text: Absolutely fabulous!! Staff are wonderful and such an amazing place.

name: The Orchard at Grantley Hall
text: Excellent every time

name: The Orchard at Grantley Hall
text: Great service.  Swordfish was very good.

name: Regency Pizza
text: Great Pizza and service. We were staying at the Pheasant Hill caravan park 3 miles from Bedale and had been out for the day stopping at Bedale on our way back. Popped into Regency to ask if they deliver to Pheasant Hill. Was told yes no problem just order online. Used the website to order and asked for the delivery to our pitch at 7pm. The delivery turned up on time. The order was correct and the pizza was perfect for our lazy weekend. Would use again without hesitation. Pizza was so good I'd eaten some before remembering to take a photo!

name: Regency Pizza
text: Absolutely awful food! I ordered doner kebab and cheese chips. I asked for chilli sauce and garlic mayo. The meat was absolutely drenched in sauce! The meat wasn't nice. Salad was awful, pitta was stale! Chips were burnt. Worst of all HYGIENE! The delivery driver walked in, didn't wash his hands, and started touching everything! I wasn't too hopeful given other reviews, but I hoped for the best! Sadly, other reviews were accurate. AVOID!

name: Regency Pizza
text: From personal experience with regency, if the pizza has no crispy edges, you will have a stomach ache.  Approx 50% orders came in with a raw douch on top side, sometimes even entire douch was mushy, even tho asked for it to be well done in notes!? I think I must have sent back over 10 pizzas past 2 years. I saw plenty similar reviews, stating their pizza was not cooked properly, so I can't get my head around it why you guys are still delivering undercooked pizzas?  Last time I ordered, the pizza came in after 2 hours cold and undercooked, was too hungry to send it back so I had to cook it in my Owen !!  Giving 2 starts as although the service is terrible and many requests are being simply ignored, the pizza when it comes as it should, does actually taste quite nice, chilli dip is amazing and the drivers can handle kitchen's errors quite well.

name: Regency Pizza
text: Simple food done well. Set in a lovely village. Hot and spicy Chicken Parmo was great.

name: Regency Pizza
text: Out of the 3 times ordering here only the last was anywhere near on, but obviously ice cold like all previous, the food is just bad and honestly overall just terrible.

name: Middleham Fish Bar
text: We just called and had Friday night fish and chips and it was fantastic. Friendly staff and fast service, the food was delicious and piping hot. The fish is battered light and beautifully and the chips were crisp and golden ... Truly delicious meal. Our best "chippy tea" in a long time. Thoroughly enjoyed and recommended. 5 stars.

name: Middleham Fish Bar
text: Fish freshly cooked - lovely thin batter and not greasy. Chips tasty. Best fish n chips we've had for ages.

name: Middleham Fish Bar
text: For the second time this year we had fish & chips from Middleham fish bar, this time we‚Äôre staying at Finghall but knew it would be worth the drive, we wasn‚Äôt disappointed both the fish And Chips was beautiful also good portion size‚Äôs Many thanks John and Wendy

name: Middleham Fish Bar
text: When I visit my mum, we sometimes get food from here. The fish has always been really tasty and they always use good sizes. The chips are quite nice as well. On top of that, some of the standout things about this place, are the people that work there, they are very friendly and always willing to talk about whatever you bring up.  The waiting section is quite small inside, however they have benches outside situated in an idyllic setting, so, they've got you covered whilst you wait. I recommend you eat from here if you want Fish and Chips üëå.

name: Middleham Fish Bar
text: The service in this fish and chip shop was absolutely terrible. The lady serving my wife was snappy, rude and impatient. She even told my wife to shut my kids up as they were ‚Äòdisturbing her customers‚Äô, my kids are 1 and 3 years old. It‚Äôs not her place to do that. I wish I could say the fish and chips were good to balance this out, but they were sub-par at best.

name: Co-op Food - Leeming Bar - Leeming Lane
text: Local store for essential needs met

name: Co-op Food - Leeming Bar - Leeming Lane
text: I have lived in this village for many years, after loosing the corner shop that was taken over by our local pizzeria. I am now so so so happy Co-op have given us a very well stocked and staffed village shop. We have an ever expanding community and this amazing commodity has lifted all our spirits... especially for non drivers and people with dietary requirements like me :) Thank You Leeming Bar Co-op Team x

name: Co-op Food - Leeming Bar - Leeming Lane
text: Good shop always stocked up with friendly staff and good prices

name: Co-op Food - Leeming Bar - Leeming Lane
text: Poor management

name: Co-op Food - Leeming Bar - Leeming Lane
text: Brilliant,handy,always help full.

name: The Bull Inn
text: Wow! Food was amazing!! Lovely location and excellent staff. Thank you for a great stay, added bonus of being able to see the donkeys in their field from our bedroom window

name: The Bull Inn
text: Lovely local pub. Barstaff was incredibly friendly, as were the punters . We were visiting our friend in the area and had a bite to eat. All in all, it is a very lovely place to visit üòä

name: The Bull Inn
text: I can't speak for the rooms but if they're as good as the service they would be ace. Wonderful location great beer ace food, I was even surprised by the staff with a birthday treat, how cool is that üëç

name: The Bull Inn
text: Probably the best pub beer garden anywhere. Right next to the river under the shade of large willows and the nearby bridge. The food is also excellent, standard pub fare but quality ingredients. It also has a marquee with a stove so that you can sit out even when its cold.

name: The Bull Inn
text: Our second visit and food excellent as previously. This visit enabled us to eat in the nicely appointed garden. A word of warning though if you have mobility issues it would be advisable to eat indoors. Access to the outdoor tables is quite steep.

name: The New Right Choice Ltd
text: Duck was ok but no plum sauce. Good portion size. Quite expensive in comparison to other local takeaways.

name: The New Right Choice Ltd
text: superb Chinese takeaway. I would say the best I have ever tasted and very pleasant staff will definitely visit again when in the area ‚ô•

name: The New Right Choice Ltd
text: Just had a sirloin steak for under a tenner... Incredible value for money... Proper  plate full of seriously good food üòã thanks guys

name: The New Right Choice Ltd
text: Just smashed my food from Right choice and as Chinese food goes it is absolutely banging. I have been all over the UK and Ireland and to be honest with you it's one of the best. I did have to wait an hour but it was worth the wait. Well worth a try if your local or visiting the area.

name: The New Right Choice Ltd
text: Great food every  single time, top quality takeaway food and great value for money

name: The Castle Arms Inn
text: We stayed here one night and also ate at the Inn as well for my 60th birthday on the recommendation of the sister in law. Our room was very clean and everything just right with free teas and coffee wifi and soaps etc. Bed was large and comfy but room was cool on our arrival but soon warmed as we turned the radiator up. Room 5 Our meal was very good for the price and we enjoyed all three courses. I ordered Seafood cocktail which came in a popadom basket which should have worked but it did, packed with seafood and salad and tangy sauce. For mains I had liver and mash and my wife had Halibut finished off with cheese board and coffee. it was quiz night as well so we had a good night and laugh. Breakfast was ample and well cooked and a range of options, I spoke with Jill who a previous reviewer who had never met her but seen her on a TV program and formed the opinion she was rude and obnoxious, I can say she was non of the these negative comments. We both found her engaging, helpful, polite and inclusive as were all her staff even the dog.

name: The Castle Arms Inn
text: Just saw this individual on the reality show Four in a bed. Appeared to revel in giving negative feedback to others, and actually laughed about one contestants poor feedback ( The cadillac kustomz hotel)  which I found rather spiteful.  Jill (The individual in question) Appeared rude, obnoxious, and full of herself. And clearly out to win this competition by fair means or foul . Found fault in every other establishment to justify poor scores and under payments . I'd rather sleep in my car than book into this establishment. Pretty toxic behaviour by both the host and her friend.

name: The Castle Arms Inn
text: Enjoyed a tasty meal here on a Sunday evening - we were pleased to find a pub serving then and not Sunday lunch only AND we could take our little dog into the bar for the meal. A few other furry faces in there too so she was happy! Tasteful decor, nice beer and a warm welcome - lovely little pub üòä

name: The Castle Arms Inn
text: Rooms were comfortable and clean. Staff were friendly. Three lovely real ales on the bar, very well kept. Food in the restaurant was superb. Thanks to Jill, Paula and Ben.

name: The Castle Arms Inn
text: Lovely pub, owners, staff, accommodation, food, beer, in a delightful village. The chef was excellent in accommodating my wife's difficult dietary issues. Hospitality at its best.

name: Fletchers Restaurant
text: Part of Grantley Halls restaurants on site. Beautifully serviced from the hosts. The Beef Wellington took 30 minutes (mentioned on menu) which is catered for a couple and did not disappointed at all.  Full of flavour. The setting was very ambient, dimmed down tungsten lights creating a relaxed, romance atmosphere.  Well done üëèüèº

name: Fletchers Restaurant
text: Absolutely superb, amazing food and excellent service! The whole experience at Grantley Hall was amazing and I could not fault one thing, such a beautiful place and the Christmas decorations made it even more special. Looking forward to another visit! We had the Christmas lunch menu which was available up to the 23rd Dec 4 courses, coffee & mince pies & glass of champagne ü•Ç for ¬£65pp great value

name: Fletchers Restaurant
text: Apart from the bar bill not being included in the final bill everything was very good indeed. Just a meal this time but perhaps we can save up for an overnight stay. Would have loved to see the spa, how about an optional tour? The staff were relaxed and friendly and the service was very good. The food was interesting and well presented. A lot of money has been spent on landscaping the large gardens and the paths and car park. Very good arrival impression.

name: Fletchers Restaurant
text: Sublime surroundings, fabulous staff and wonderful food, should be 10 stars but can only rate 5. The attention to detail is second to none. Could give the bathroom  at least 7 stars.

name: Fletchers Restaurant
text: Superb meal , very friendly and warm welcome , Adam who assisted with the wine choices was first class and we're looking forward to coming again .

name: Fairhurst‚Äôs at Berry's Caf√© and Farm Shop
text: Expensive but very good quality. Would be nice to get 2 sausages and perhaps a hash brown with breakfast. Given the location is so beautiful and remote it is a very nice breakfast in a lovely environment. Staff were really young and really friendly and helpful. A great addition to the farm. Plenty of parking on site.

text: Food was fantastic -though pricey - with lots of choice. Extensive breakfast menu up to 12pm and nice lunches with daily specials. text: We called in to the shop to buy our evening meal (frozen ready meal chicken and sides), plus the 10 year old wanted Peppermint Canes!  We went back a 2nd time as the carnivores so enjoyed theirs and it was generous fir two people.  The cafe was closed when we called in from our adventures exploringbthe Dale's. There is also a Gift Shop and a Wellness Centre. You will need to go onto their website to see what that is allabout!  Accessibility: Ramp in from the car park, no designated bays, but spaces close to the entrance.  No emergency cord in the loo, but there are bars.  Car Park: Free  Staff: Lovely and helpful.  Toilets: Assisted (bars) rather than disabled as no emergency cord.

text: Popped into Berry's this morning driving a scenic route home from Cumbria to Norfolk. I had a very lovely fruit scone, jam and cream, my hubby had veggie breakfast which he enjoyed. Coffees were also good. So glad to have found this gem. Dog friendly too which is always a bonus. Staff all very friendly. Will be back.
